intro: Niebuhria madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are often pale blue or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
